# clientRecord

**Instance Property**

The local version of the record that includes any changes.

## Declaration

```swift
var clientRecord: CKRecord? { get }
```

## Discussion

This property’s value is available only when the error’s `code` is [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKError/serverRecordChanged], which indicates the server’s record is newer than the version you try to save. Use this property’s value, along with those of [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKError/ancestorRecord] and [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKError/serverRecord], to resolve the conflict.

The error’s `userInfo` dictionary contains the same value as this property. you can access it using the [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKRecordChangedErrorClientRecordKey] key.

## Getting Conflicted Records

- **ancestorRecord**: The original version of the record.
- **serverRecord**: The server’s version of the record.
